results.title: Beginners please
results.creator_credit: Exclusive Films, Gaumont-British Instructional, BFI and Donald Carter
results.brief_description: All physical training must be begun gently; gymnastics should be started with light excerises. This film demonstrates games designed to ease the muscles before going on to more strenuous and involved movements.

results.title: Beginners please
results.creator_credit: South Australian Housing Trust and Colin Ballantyne
results.brief_description: A brief survey of Elizabeth, South Australia focusing on the history of the building of the twin theatres, the Octagon (an eight-sided structure) and the Shedley (smaller and more intimate).

results.title: Before it's too late
results.brief_description: A road safety film emphasizing the importance of using seat belts in vehicles and how they do save lives. Collision tests conducted at the University of California show what can happen in an accident. The uncontrolled movements can damage the body in numerous ways, ejection being the most fatal. Thousands of lives could have been saved if people used their seat belts rather than sat on them. Features Dick Van Dyke.

results.title: Before death us do part: a do-it-yourself guide to divorce
results.creator_credit: Yarra Bank Films, Film Victoria, Sharon Connolly, Trevor Graham and Tony Wright
results.brief_description: A humourous but educational approach looking at the process of how to obtain a divorce in Australia. Using the forum of a talk-back radio program, callers with questions about divorce are dealt with by the announcer, Abby Wright, in a clear and informative style. The program is accompanied by a User Guide and can be used as an educational tool in demonstrating the process of obtaining a divorce in Australia.
results.title_for_label: Before death us do part: a do-it-yourself guide to divorce

results.title: Before 9:30
results.creator_credit: Macquarie University. Dept. of Media and Communication Studies and Brigid Kitchin
results.brief_description: Inspired by a real life incident, this short film is a timely and poignant reminder about the anguish experienced by young children at primary school. Intended as a discussion piece for counsellors, teachers and family care workers. Cast includes Evan Sheaves, Jessica Rees and Nathy Gaffney.

results.title: Beetles
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Life histories of the tiger, ladybird and Japanese beetles. Many rarely observed events in their lives are presented: some comic, some tragic. The economic relations of beetles to man is brought out. Some beetles have been pressed into the service of man, while others are harmful and must be destroyed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Beethoven. Beethoven's 2nd
results.brief_description: Beethoven: Kidnapped from a pet store, an energetic St. Bernard puppy manages to escape from his kidnappers. He flees into the Newton house where he is discovered by the youngest child, Emily. Her siblings Ryce and Ted, and their mother, Alice (Bonnie Hunt), join forces to convince family patriarch George (Charles Grodin) that they should keep the puppy. Despite not being an animal lover, George agrees, and Beethoven becomes a member of the Newton family. Helping Ryce get the attention of the boy she likes, saving Ted from bullies and Emily from drowning are just some of the adventures the over-sized destructive dog gets up to. When an evil vet (Dean Jones) needs a big dog for one of his experiments, Beethoven is his first choice and the family have to race against time to stop the vet from experimenting on their beloved pet. Cast also includes Oliver Platt, Stanley Tucci, David Duchovny and Patricia Heaton. “Beethoven’s 2nd”: The original cast reunite in the sequel to the 1992 film about Beethoven, the oversized, slobbering member of the Newton family. Beethoven meets a St. Bernard named Missy at the park and falls in love and soon Beethoven and Missy are the proud parents of four. Unfortunately, Missy is a pawn in her owner’s divorce and while Regina (Debi Mazar) sees her as a way of getting a better settlement from her ex-husband, she has no interest in the puppies. When Ted and Emily overhear Regina’s orders for the puppies to be drowned, they kidnap them and hide them in the family basement. Dolly, Mo, Tchaikovsky and Chubby are impossible to keep quiet and George eventually discovers what his children have been hiding from him. Agreeing to keep the puppies until they are old enough to be given away, George and family - puppies included, go on holiday to a mountain retreat. While there, they are spotted by Regina who has decided that the pure bred puppies will earn her quite a bit of money. In true Cruella de Ville style, she steals the puppies and it is up to Beethoven and the Newtons to find the puppies before they are sold. Also stars Chris Penn.

results.title: Beethoven, Symphony No. 8 in F Major (Tempo Di Minueto -3rd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music in Motion”.
Beethoven often found his musical motives and themes in scenes of nature; scenes of the peacefully flowing Rhine river, ruined castles, leaves turning in the sun, an open field of grain express the charm and individuality of this movement of Beethoven’s Eight Symphony. No other credits are available.
